question: Does intramembrane cleavage by signal peptide peptidase (SPP) promote ER-associated proteasomal degradation of polytopic or complex-topology membrane proteins? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: RHBDL4 cleaves single-spanning and polytopic membrane proteins with unstable transmembrane helices, leading to their degradation by the canonical ERAD machinery.
content.source_2: RHBDL4 functioned as a ubiquitin-independent ER intramembrane protease that was downregulated by ER stress and failed to promote clearance of polytopic substrates.
content.source_3: By catalyzing intramembrane scission within unstable helices, signal peptide peptidase accelerates the extraction and ER-associated degradation of multi-pass membrane proteins with complex topology.
content.source_4: Signal peptide peptidase activity was confined to processing signal peptides and did not enhance degradation of polytopic proteins, which remained stable despite ER stress.
